intro: Galium verum proles crebrifolium, commonly known as yellow bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and slender, hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its distinct appearance. Galium verum proles crebrifolium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
